sentence.Network_en: As the egg whites cook, they coagulate and rise to the surface.
sentence.Network_cn: 蛋白一煮就会凝结，并且浮起来。

sentence.Network_en: Blood began to coagulate around the edges of the wound.
sentence.Network_cn: 血液开始在伤口的边缘凝固。

sentence.Network_en: Most polymer emulsion may coagulate when they enter waste streams.
sentence.Network_cn: 多数聚合物乳浊液在进入废水流时可能凝聚.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin coagulat- 'curdled', from the verb coagulare, from coagulum 'rennet'

entry.def: When a liquid coagulates, it becomes very thick.

example.ex: As the egg whites cook, they coagulate and rise to the surface...
example.tran: 蛋白一煮就会凝结，并且浮起来。

example.ex: The blood coagulates to stop wounds bleeding.
example.tran: 血液凝结，使伤口不再出血。

means.word_mean: 1. change from a liquid to a thickened or solid state;
2. cause to change from a liquid to a solid or thickened state
1. transformed from a liquid into a soft semisolid or solid mass;

auth_sentence.content: The curds will coagulate and separate from the watery whey.
auth_sentence.res_content: The curds will coagulate and separate from the watery whey.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The curds will coagulate and separate from the watery whey.

auth_sentence.content: I stopped the bleeding by lying still and letting it coagulate.
auth_sentence.res_content: I stopped the bleeding by lying still and letting it coagulate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I stopped the bleeding by lying still and letting it coagulate.

auth_sentence.content: If it is possible to coagulate photons, we can form many particles.
auth_sentence.res_content: If it is possible to coagulate photons, we can form many particles.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If it is possible to coagulate photons, we can form many particles.

sentences.en: Blood coagulates when it meets air.
sentences.cn: 血液接触空气就会凝结。
